info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 12:23PM EST until January 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected, falling heavily at times, with totals of 3 to 7 inches expected and locally higher totals possible as lake effect snow often varies greatly over short distances. * WHERE...Porter County, especially northeast of a line from Portage to Kouts, including Valparaiso. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening to 6 PM CST Thursday, with the heaviest snowfall rates of one inch per hour or greater expected at times overnight and Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and rapid drops in visibility. Travel could become very difficult in places. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute, including along the Interstate 80, 90, and 94 corridors. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Breezy northerly winds could cause blowing and drifting snow and further reduce visibility when combined with heavy snowfall rates.
info.instruction: Plan for hazardous conditions if traveling. Slow down and use caution. The latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1- 800-261-7623.
